page.title: 11MOAT FARM
page.content: MOAT FARM (CONT FROM PAGE 10) The working day starts at 7.45 a.m. when the workers arrive. They have to assess the weather and decide what jobs need to be done. Arable farms are highly mechanized and most of the work on the farm is done by machine. The workers need to know about and work the various machines, eg. tractors, potato harvester, combine harvester and gooseberry picker. The men then work until 10.00 a.m. when they stop for a short coffee break. Work continues until 1.00 p.m. lunch time. They start again at 1.30 and continue until 4.30 p.m. If there is extra work to be done which is very likely in the summer during harvest time the men work overtime for which they get paid above their normal hourly rate.
